introduction: The video introduces the concept of slow performance when selecting all columns (SELECT \* ) in a relational database. The author explains that the reason behind this is that reading all columns requires a full table scan, which can be inefficient. They then delve into the details of how databases read data, including the concept of pages, rows, and columns.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to Select \*
content: Explanation of the concept of slow performance when selecting all columns.
Discussion on why selecting all columns can be inefficient.
Introduction to the concept of pages and rows in databases.
Overview of the impact of columns on performance.

sections.title: Section 2: Full Table Scan
content: Explanation of the full table scan process.
Discussion on the efficiency of full table scans.
Explanation of how databases read data in pages.
Overview of the impact of full table scans on performance.

sections.title: Section 3: Reading Data in Pages
content: Explanation of the process of reading data in pages.
Discussion on the impact of page size on performance.
Explanation of how databases map pages to the file system.
Overview of the impact of page size on performance.

sections.title: Section 4: Shared Buffers
content: Explanation of the concept of shared buffers.
Discussion on how shared buffers improve performance.
Explanation of the role of shared buffers in the database.
Overview of the impact of shared buffers on performance.

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion
content: Summary of the key points discussed in the video.
Discussion on the importance of understanding database performance.
Explanation of the role of the database in modern applications.
Overview of the impact of database performance on overall system performance.
